title: W3.CSSCards

metadata.description: Learn about W3.CSSCards with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
John Architect and engineer Header Some text.. Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipisicing elit, sed do eiusmod tempor incididunt ut labore et dolore magna aliqua. Ut enim ad minim veniam, quis nostrud exercitation ullamco laboris nisi ut aliquip ex ea commodo consequat. Footer W3.CSS Card Classes W3.CSS provides the following classes for displaying paper-like cards: Class Defines w3-card Same as w3-card-2 w3-card-2 Container for any HTML content (2px bordered shadow) w3-card-4 Container for any HTML content (4px bordered shadow) Colored Cards To display colored cards, just add w3- color class: w3-card w3-card-2 w3-card-4 Example (White Cards)

w3-card

Example (Yellow Cards)

w3-card

Card Content Header Some text.. Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipisicing elit, sed do eiusmod tempor incididunt ut labore et dolore magna aliqua. Ut enim ad minim veniam, quis nostrud exercitation ullamco laboris nisi ut aliquip ex ea commodo consequat. Footer Add containers inside the card to create different sections: Example

Header

Lorem ipsum...

Footer
Photo Card The Italian / Austrian Alps Example

The Italian / Austrian Alps

Hover Effect The w3-hover-shadow class adds a shadow effect on hover - this will make any element look like a card on mouse-over (same style as w3-card-4). Hover over me! Example

Hover over me!

More Examples Friend Request John Doe Accept Decline Example

Friend request

summary: This tutorial covers W3.CSSCards concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use W3.CSSCards effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of W3.CSSCards and how to apply it in your projects.
